metadata.title: CVE-2013-5914 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the ssl_read_record function in ssl_tls.c in PolarSSLbefore 1.1.8, when using TLS 1.1, might allow remote attackers to executearbitrary code via a long packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5914` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmbedcrypto0 - 1.2.8-2
libmbedtls10 - 1.2.8-2
libmbedx509-0 - 1.2.8-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mbedtls package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.8-2').
